security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation instructions. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Understanding an existing codebase requires accurate technical documentation. This skill creates precise maps of CookMode V2 architecture, file locations, and component interactions without suggesting changes.
actual_capabilities: Documents existing CookMode V2 components with file paths and line numbers
Explains data flow through React hooks and Supabase subscriptions
Maps project directory structure and key files
Provides technical maps of architecture without modifications
Answers questions about current implementation details
limitations: Only documents CookMode V2 project, not general codebases
Does not suggest improvements, refactoring, or optimizations
Does not perform root cause analysis or critique implementation
Does not recommend architectural changes or future enhancements

use_cases.title: Onboard to codebase
use_cases.description: New team members quickly understand CookMode V2 structure, file locations, and how components connect.

use_cases.title: Verify component locations
use_cases.description: Find exact file paths and line numbers for existing features before making changes.

use_cases.title: Generate documentation
use_cases.description: Create accurate technical documentation from factual maps of the existing implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Component overview
prompt_templates.prompt: What does the RecipeModal component do and where is it implemented?

prompt_templates.title: Data flow mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: How does recipe data flow through the system from Supabase to the UI?

prompt_templates.title: File location search
prompt_templates.prompt: Where is the useRecipeData hook defined and what state does it manage?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Document the current state of the CookMode V2 project including key directories and component flow.

output_examples.input: How does the recipe scaling feature work?
output: **What**: Allows users to scale ingredient quantities based on order count (1-50x)
**How**: User adjusts slider, handleOrderChange validates, scaleAmount multiplies quantities, ingredients re-render
**Interactions**: Updates Supabase table, real-time sync via useRealtime hook

best_practices: Ask for specific components or features to get focused documentation
Request file paths with line numbers when you need to locate code
Use this skill before making changes to understand the current state
anti_patterns: Asking for improvements or refactoring suggestions
Requesting help with debugging or root cause analysis
Asking about features that do not exist in the current codebase

faq.question: What platforms is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides documentation capabilities across all three platforms.

faq.question: What is the scope of this documentation skill?
faq.answer: This skill only documents CookMode V2 codebase. It cannot provide documentation for other projects or general programming topics.

faq.question: Can this skill help me make changes to the codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill only describes what exists. For changes, improvements, or fixes, use other skills or request them explicitly.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill with no code execution, network access, or filesystem operations beyond what the platform allows.

faq.question: Why does this skill refuse to suggest improvements?
faq.answer: This skill strictly maps existing code. Suggestions require analysis that may not be accurate. Explicitly ask another skill for recommendations.

faq.question: How is this different from asking Claude directly about CookMode V2?
faq.answer: This skill has specialized knowledge of CookMode V2 architecture, file structure, and patterns from the SKILL.md definition. It provides more accurate and structured documentation.
